input_text.Prompt:
By Kang Seung-woo

The military will develop robots to detect and remove mines in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ).

"We will embark on the development project from 2017," a military official said Thursday. "The demining robots will be used in rear-areas operations, including handling explosives as well as removing landmines buried in the DMZ."

About 170 robots will be put into operation in the early 2020s, and the budget for the development is estimated to be less than 500 billion won ($431 million).

The project comes after two South Korean soldiers patrolling the DMZ were severely wounded by a North Korean landmine attack on Aug. 4 that pushed South and North Korea to the brink of a military confrontation across the border.

Meanwhile, the Defense Acquisition Program Administration (DAPA) said Wednesday the military will develop 100 unmanned vehicles for DMZ search operations.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A: The military plans to develop robots to detect and remove landmines in the Demilitarized Zone. About 170 robots will be deployed in the early 2020s. The budget for the development is estimated to be less than 500 billion won. The development will start in 2017. The demining robots will be used not only for removing landmines in the DMZ but also for handling explosives. The plan is in response to the North Korean landmine attack that wounded two South Korean soldiers in the DMZ. The military will also develop 100 unmanned vehicles for search operations in the DMZ.
input_text.Response B: South Korea's military will begin developing robots to detect and remove mines in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) from 2017, with a view to using them in rear-area operations, including handling explosives as well as removing landmines buried in the DMZ. Around 170 robots will be put into operation in the early 2020s and the budget for the development is estimated to be less than 500bn won ($431m). The project comes after two South Korean soldiers patrolling the DMZ were severely wounded by a North Korean landmine attack on 4 August that pushed South and North Korea to the brink of a military confrontation across the border.

input_meta.preamble_b: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.
